{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3499886,"name":"Karthik Singaravadivelan","username":"karthiksing05","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/e8c25b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-02T15:56:26.578Z","cooked":"

Hello! This is my first post on Chief Delphi so please let me know if I need to add any information and I’ll do so promptly.

This is our team’s first year in properly using PathPlanner - we are running a fully-Kraken Swerve Drive and using the CTRE Swerve Generator Tool for our code. We also have vision-based odometry via PhotonVision. I’ve tuned the PID gains well enough via SysID for long-distance path-planning - we’re able to path-find from anywhere on the field to a predetermined offset position from the reef with high consistency with our vision-odometry setup.

My idea for the control loop were to have one command drive the robot up to a predetermined offset to a side of the reef, and then one of two pathfinding commands being ran to align the robot to either side of the reef.

The reproducible error happens when I path-find to the first position (Reef Vague Alignment) and then to a second position (Reef Center Position) that is only an offset of (0.348m, 0.0m) from the first position. However, pathfinding to a second position (Right Reef Alignment) that is (0.348m, -0.348m) from the original position works. It seems to be that the error is that the robot cannot pathfind to positions that are extremely close to its current position - I’ve been looking for some kind of error deadband to adjust that determines when the pathfinding command should stop running but have had no luck so far.

I’d appreciate any tips to resolve the PathPlanner issue, or any ideas to align with either side of the reef through small swerve adjustments that don’t involve pathfinding!

The command I am using to generate a path-following command is under subsystems.swerve.CommandSwerveDrivetrain.driveToPose - the specific commands I’m calling this method under is commands.swerve.DriveToClosestReef and commands.swerve.AutoLineUpReef. Our code is linked below:

github.com

GitHub - Metal-Crusaders/Reefscape2025Code: Metal Crusaders' official code for Reefscape 2025!

Metal Crusaders' official code for Reefscape 2025!

Thank you all in advance! Looking forward to resolving this soon!

Welcome to CD and thank you for explaining everything in your post so clearly. This is from the pathplanner dev:

PathPlanner 2025

This is a limitation of pathfinding, but not on the fly paths. Make sure the rotation component in the poses you use for the waypointsFromPoses method represent direction of travel, not robot rotation. That could explain the non-linear paths you mentioned.

Awesome, thank you so much for the speedy reply! The fix for this (for anyone who comes across the same error) was just programming my own PID control loops using similar translational and rotational PID values to PathPlanner - there’s code on our repository now for anyone interested!

I am having trouble making my own PID controller for ctre phoenix6 swerve.
Is this what you meant?:

    public Pose2d addRCtoFC(Pose2d robotPose, int right) {
        double xOffset = Constants.AutoDriveConstants.ADDITIONS[right][0];
        double yOffset = Constants.AutoDriveConstants.ADDITIONS[right][1];

        double newX = robotPose.getX() + (xOffset * Math.cos(robotPose.getRotation().getRadians()) - yOffset * Math.sin(robotPose.getRotation().getRadians()));
        double newY = robotPose.getY() + (xOffset * Math.sin(robotPose.getRotation().getRadians()) + yOffset * Math.cos(robotPose.getRotation().getRadians()));
        Pose2d calculated = new Pose2d(newX, newY, robotPose.getRotation());
        return calculated;
    }
